revised_title: Comparative Anatomy of Nautilus umbilicatus and Nautilus Pompilius
tldr: This article compares the anatomy of Nautilus umbilicatus and Nautilus Pompilius, two species of cephalopods. The author examines their physical differences, such as body size and shape, and internal structures like their reproductive systems and organs. The study provides insights into the evolutionary relationship between the two species and their distinct characteristics.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Comparative Anatomy
